column1: Cystinuria is a rare condition in which stones made from an amino acid called cystine form in the kidney, ureter, and bladder.
About one in every 10,000 people have cystinuria.
Symptoms include: - Blood in the urine - Flank pain or pain in the side or back.
The goal of treatment is to relieve symptoms and prevent more stones from forming.
A person with severe symptoms may need to go into the hospital.
You may need pain relievers to control pain in the kidney or bladder area when you pass stones.
- Ureteroscopy, for stones in the lower urinary tract.
Call your health care provider if you have symptoms of urinary tract stones.
Any person with a known history of stones in the urinary tract should drink plenty of fluids to regularly produce a high amount of urine.
